description: Enterovirus 71 (EV71) is a human enterovirus belonging to the Picorna6iridae family. It was first isolated in California in 1969 from the stool sample from an infant with encephalitis. EV71 is one of the major causative agents of hand, foot, and mouth disease (HFMD) and is now recognized as an emerging neurotropic virus in Asia and may cause severe neurologic complications and mortalities.
name: Enterovirus 71 (EV71) Antibodies and Antigens
